intro: Raimannia indecora, commonly known as the false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and wetlands. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are yellow and arranged in a cluster. Raimannia indecora is often found in disturbed soils and can spread through both seeds and vegetative propagation.
